question: The most radiosensitive phase of cell cycle is:
exp: Radiosensitivity of the cell cycle pahses : G2M > M > G2> G1> S. G2M is most Radiosensitive phase and S phase is most radioresistant phase

question: Maximum Permitted Radiation exposure in a occupational worker per year is?
exp: AERB guidelines: Dose Limitations Pa of the body Occupational Exposure Public Exposure Whole body (Effective dose) 20 mSv/year averaged over 5 consecutive years; 30 mSv/year in any single year 1 mSv/y Lens of eyes (Equivalent dose) 150 mSv in a year 15 msv/y Skin (Equivalent dose 500 msv in a year 50 mSv/y Extremities (Hands and Feat) Equivalent dose 500 mSv in a year - For pregnant radiation workers, after declaration of pregnancy 1 mSv on the embryo/fetus should not exceed.

question: Most ionizing radiation among the following is?
exp: Alpha rays have the highest ionization power, whereas gamma rays have the highest penetration power.

question: Most Radiosensitive Ocular structure is?
exp: *Most radiosensitive ocular structure is Lens *Most radioresistant Ocular Structure is Sclera

question: Radioisotopes produce all the following except?
exp: Radioactive elements emit Alpha Rays, Beta and Gamma Rays. X-rays are produced when fast moving electrons from cathode strike the target of Anode of Xray Tube.

question: Radiorestistant tumor is-
exp: RADIORESISTANT RADIOSENSITIVE Osteosarcoma Wilms tumor Melanoma Ewing's sarcoma Hepatic carcinoma Lymphoma Pancreatic carcinoma Myeloma Seminoma / Dysgerminoma

question: Which Of the following statements is True?
exp: Inverse Square Law states that Radiation Dose is inversely propoional to the square of distance from the Source of Radiation
opa: Intensity of Radiation decreases as a function of the distance from source of radiation
opb: Intensity Of Radiation Increases as a function of distance from source of radiation
opc: Intensity of Radiation decreases as a function of square of distance from source of Radiation
opd: Intensity Of Radiation increases as a function of square of distance from source of Radiation
